title: Worked Solution
text:
To express \(h(x) $$=$$ (x+2)**2\) as a composition of two functions \(h(x) $$=$$ f(g(x))\), we need to break it down into two separate functions, \(f(x)\) and \(g(x)\), where one function is applied inside the other.

The function \(h(x) $$=$$ (x+2)**2\) is basically squaring the result of adding $$2$$ to \(x\). So, we can divide this operation into two parts: the inner part \(g(x)\), which adds $$2$$ to \(x\), and the outer part \(f(x)\), which squares its input.

$$1$$. **For \(g(x) $$=$$ $$x$$ + 2\):** This represents the operation of adding $$2$$ to \(x\), which matches the inner operation of \(h(x)\).

$$2$$. **For \(f(x) $$=$$ x**2\):** This represents the operation of squaring the input, which is the outer operation applied to the result of \(g(x)\).

So, when you combine these two functions, you get \(h(x) $$=$$ f(g(x)) $$=$$ $${g{\left(xight)}}^2$$ $$=$$ (x + 2)**2\), which matches the given \(h(x)\).

Therefore, the correct answer is **g(x) $$=$$ $$x$$ + $$2$$, f(x) $$=$$ x**2**.
